job_description:
As we enter into this next phase of growth, we are looking to more than double our team and implement creative talent processes and strategies that can preserve and grow our culture of innovation. We are looking to make our first talent acquisition hire to help us scale and build out a world-class team. While the majority of our hiring will be for technical roles, we are looking for a technical recruiter to help us build a leading and diverse engineering team.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop overall talent acquisition strategy
  • Build out processes and tools necessary to manage TA at scale
  • End-to-end recruitment from sourcing through to close
  • Understand business goal and manage internal stakeholders to drive outcomes
  • Partner with hiring managers to develop and execute systematic hiring process across all searches
  • Develop and maintain an excellent candidate experience
  • Identify, source, and interview candidates
  • Manage recruiting support team

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of talent acquisition at a high growth company
  • Experience recruiting for technical and non technical positions
  • Ability to think strategically about how to achieve goals and the humility and execution orientation necessary to achieve them
  • Equally comfortable sourcing candidates as you interviewing and building relationships with them
  • Team management experience desired but not required
  • Passion for crypto and decentralized finance

Nice to Haves:

  • Love for unicorns <3

We are looking for an energetic, people person to assist us with finding, attracting and hiring talent across Uniswap Labs. You'll be responsible for keeping the recruiting trains running on time - making sure no candidate gets less than the attention they deserve. This will be the second Recruiting Coordinator of our growing team and will be a hybrid position out of our SoHo office.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with recruiters and hiring managers to manage various hiring pipelines
  • Schedule interviews and debriefs
  • Help create a stellar candidate experience, inclusive of maintaining an office space that candidates and employees love going to
  • Stay closely in touch with candidates and their timelines throughout the process
  • Assist in planning, coordinating and setting up networking and recruiting events
  • Onboard new hires so that they are up and running as soon as possible

Requirements:

  • Proficiency with an Applicant Tracking System or willingness to quickly learn
  • Comfortable working with Google Calendar and managing events on multiple calendars
  • Energetic and strong interpersonal skills to represent us externally
  • Self-motivated to get things done without waiting for directions

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience with Greenhouse
  • 1+ years of experience recruiting at a fast growing company
  • Excited and curious about blockchain, crypto and/or DeFi
  • Love for unicorns :)

Uniswap Labs is hiring for Enterprise Partnerships.
 
We are looking to hire a seasoned sell-side research sales professional with established hedge fund and/or asset manager relationships to head up our Traditional Finance (TradFi) partnerships. This role is as much about business development strategy as it is business development execution. You will need to be able to and have the relationships and deep financial understanding necessary to drive sales, user research and product discovery/strategy (e.g. do we need permission pools? what L&C considerations do we need to address?).

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and establish partnerships with traditional finance capital that will trade or provide liquidity on Uniswap
  • Ability to identify relevant partnerships/integrations, take initiative, and own the sales cycle end-to-end
  • Help shape our product strategy 
  • Develop tools that will support TradFi activity

Requirements:

  • 5-15 years of experience in sell-side research sales
  • Established relationships with hedge funds and/or asset managers to drive sales
  • Deep understanding of finance including how decision making works at fund, including legal & compliance considerations
  • Passion for crypto and how to grow crypto adoption in traditional finance
  • Strategic thinker & resourceful problem solver
  • Tenacious with strong interpersonal and communication skills

Nice to Haves:

  • Love for unicorns :)

The Uniswap community is one of the most impactful groups, inclusive of everyone from developers to traders. Weâ€™re looking for a Community Lead with a strong understanding of Ethereum, DeFi fundamentals, decentralized communities and community-building tools to support and engage with the Uniswap community.
 
This role will be a highly visible role in the organization and in the broader ecosystem. You will not only manage our day-to-day online presence, you will also be responsible for keeping your finger on the pulse of whatâ€™s happening in the DeFi and greater crypto space. You will help with hiring and training a team of global community managers. You should love community-building and have a knack for developing online relationships. You will be joining a lean team, and this role will have a lot of autonomy-- you should be a self-starter and be capable of self-directed work. This role will be impactful to our ever-growing community - reinventing what a community is at the heart of crypto.
 
Most importantly, you should care deeply about the mission of decentralized communities and decentralized finance and always be thinking of creative ways to help spread the word.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand Uniswapâ€™s tone and messaging and apply this by engaging with users on twitter and in our discord
  • Deep technical understanding of Uniswapâ€™s mechanisms and ability to answer questions and speak to users and integration partners
  • Manage support requests
  • Attend virtual and in person conferences and hackathons, support hackers, and generally engage with the developer community around Uniswap
  • Create fun community engagement programs, such as giveaways or virtual events
  • Host a monthly Uniswap community call
  • Manage our mailing list and create periodic newsletter updates
  • Create dank memes
  • Develop new ways of engaging with our users and community
  • Work with the business development team to turn community engagement into active BD opportunities
  • Thought leadership on issues in the DeFi space via twitter and the Uniswap blog

Requirements:

  • Experience working in community management for a crypto project
  • Organizational skills
  • Self-directed worker
  • Ability to respond very quickly across all of our platforms
  • Sense of humor

Nice to Haves:

  • Degree in computer science/self-taught engineer
  • Active following on twitter
  • Existing relationships in the crypto space
  • Fondness for the color pink
  • Love for unicorns :)

Minimum full-time salary of $110,000-$150,000. Disclosure in accordance with New York City's Pay Transparency Law. Full Time employees at Uniswap Labs are also eligible for other compensation elements, including equity, tokens, and benefits, dependent on the position type.

As a technical writer, you'll be working closely with the product development team to explain how Uniswap Protocol works at every level. There's some catchup we want to play in terms of our docs, as well as supporting new functionality on our existing roadmap.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the team to create and maintain a central docs site for the Uniswap Protocol - targeted at fast growing audience of external developers, traders and crypto curious visitors
  • Identify and write User Guides and Tutorials targeting popular user actions/flows on the site (like trading, adding liquidity, etc)
  • Monitor external channels (like Discord) where target audience of these docs may provide feedback

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience working closely with engineers to document, understand and explain technical concepts
  • Excellent English writing skills (and please submit a link to a sample as part of your application)
  • Comfortable reading code (with some pointers when necessary) to parse out salient steps
  • Creative skills and usage of pictures, drawings, diagrams, animation, and charts that may increase understanding
  • Keen eye for honing in on the most important bits to explain a complex topic, without skipping the details

Nice to Haves:

  • Prior experience in crypto/finance industry
  • Prior experience as a writer, technical writer, community manager, developer evangelist/relations, etc.
  • Comfortable submitting changes via Github (website UI or otherwise)
  • Love for Unicorns :)

Weâ€™re looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated designer to help us build the next generation of financial products. Youâ€™ll be joining a small but close knit product team known for developing category-defining UX. As a Product Designer youâ€™ll be deep in solving cutting edge human computer interface problems, developing new mental models for the next million users of decentralized finance, and defining the design culture of a small but growing organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the entire team to design, research and ship new and improved products that increase clarity and user agency of decentralized finance.
  • Wrangle difficult problems in emerging technology, help invent new mental models, and design cutting edge interactions.
  • Define the design culture at Uniswap through writing, external communication, and new processes.
  • Create a unified design language that increases the velocity of the frontend engineering team.

Requirements:

  • 1-3 years of product design experience including research, prototyping and implementation of user-facing applications.
  • Prior experience working with component libraries or design systems.
  • A desire to design within the context of web3/blockchain/decentralized finance.
  • Experience designing with Figma, Framer or other modern design tools.

Nice to Haves:

  • Familiarity with the web3/Ethereum (wallets, tokens, transactions etc.)
  • High fidelity prototyping experience
  • Love for unicorns :)

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated Product thinker and doer. You’ll work closely with engineers and designers to prioritize, spec and build new products and features. You need to have a solid technical background, uncanny attention to detail and a sound judgment.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with designers and engineers to create product specs
  • Be the glue (or the grease) that runs our product development engine
  • Launch new products and features, test their performance, and iterate quickly
  • Understand markets, competition, and user requirements in depth

Requirements

  • 5 years of experience, consumer focused with a growth mindset
  • You are an empathetic communicator and natural collaborator who can work with people across the org
  • You have built and shipped Web2 consumer products at scale (to millions of users at least)
  • You understand value of data/analytics and have an instinct to build great products
  • You have a strong interest in Crypto/blockchain space

Nice to have

  • Prior experience building in crypto/DeFi
  • Technical degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Love for unicorns :)

Documentation is a core part of Uniswap Labs, driving developers to build integrations and applications on top of the Uniswap Protocol. Weâ€™re looking for an enthusiastic and creative full-stack engineer to build the next generation of our developer documentation product. You will be responsible for architecting a sustainable, consistent, and high-quality developer experience, and help us reimagine what great technical documentation looks like for crypto developers.
 
You are the perfect candidate if you have extensive experience developing in modern SSG frameworks (Next.js preferred), with the ability to autonomously structure a project from the ground up with modern best practices and appropriate abstractions.
 
Responsibilities
  • Build and improve the tools and systems that enable Uniswap Labs to produce and maintain high-quality documentation
  • Implement new documentation experiences and gather a solid understanding of how developers integrate with Uniswap Protocol
  • Assess current authoring systems and make it easier to create, maintain, and deploy accurate documentation for our developer interfaces (protocol, smart contracts, SDKs, and APIs)
  • Raise the bar for product quality while ensuring the documentation continues to grow in scope with the evolutions of the Uniswap Protocol

Requirements

  • Have a passion for building engaging and intuitive user experiences, and a keen eye for detail
  • Enjoy working across the stack, from frontend to backend, to solve complex challenges and delight our users
  • Experience with React, Next.js, and other frontend technologies
  • Understanding of SSG best practices, SEO
  • Ability to streamline and automate contribution pipelines, CI, testing, and release cycles

Nice to Have

  • Prior experience developing markdown-driven static sites.
  • Love for unicorns :)

Weâ€™re looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated engineer to help us build the next generation of financial products. As an engineer, you will gain ownership over our existing suite of web products, as well as the ability to influence the creation, design, and execution of future products. You will be responsible for ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience across trading interfaces, data-heavy analytics pages, documentation portals and more.
 
While we have other specialized roles posted, this is meant for engineers who can span multiple parts of the stack: frontend, backend and smart contract.
 
Responsibilities
  • Work closely with product and design to rapidly iterate, experiment and launch products
  • Participate in discussions from the initial product ideas to launch
  • Own products end to end - including UI, backend, testing, etc

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience across React, Redux, Node, Python, etc.
  • Experience building and maintaining a production system at scale
  • A deep understanding of the architecture of modern React applications and backends
  • Prior experience working closely with a designer to iterate on a product
  • A desire to keep up with modern best practices in web development

Nice to Have

  • Experience with TypeScript in React
  • Degree in computer science
  • Love for unicorns :)

Uniswap Labs builds products that help millions of people access DeFi simply and securely â€’ from the Uniswap Web App and Wallet to crypto infrastructure like the Uniswap Trading API, and Unichain. Uniswap Labs also contributes to the development of the Uniswap Protocol, which has processed over $2.9 trillion in volume across thousands of tokens on Ethereum and 12+ other chains.

When you join Uniswap, you become part of a team that's reshaping the way value flows on the internet.

We are looking for an experienced smart contract engineer to help us build the next generation of the Uniswap Protocol. You will be responsible for implementing and designing smart contracts for the next generation of the most popular decentralized trading protocol on Ethereum.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role has the option to be partially or fully remote.

Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to the Uniswap protocol by designing and implement smart contracts
  • Research, apply, and invent new smart contract paradigms
  • Design and implement peripheral mechanisms to the Uniswap protocol

Requirements:

  • 4+ years of experience building and releasing production grade Solidity contracts
  • A deep understanding of the Ethereum Virtual Machine
  • Prior experience deploying complex smart contract systems to the Ethereum mainnet

Nice to Haves:

  • Degree in math or computer science
  • Experience implementing complex math in Solidity
  • Experience with React, Redux and other frontend technologies
  • Love for unicorns :)

Minimum full-time salary of $290,000-$325,000. Disclosure in accordance with New York City's Pay Transparency Law. Full Time employees at Uniswap Labs are also eligible for other compensation elements, including equity, tokens, and benefits, dependent on the position type.

Uniswap Labs' Full-Time employee benefits include company-paid medical, dental, & vision for you and your dependents, gym subsidy, 401(k) with 4% employer contribution, annual $1,500 education stipend, unlimited and encouraged time off, up to 16 weeks paid parental leave, home office setup stipend for remote employees and daily lunches at NY headquarters (all benefits are subject to applicable taxes and based on eligibility).

Uniswap Labs is committed to diversity in our workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability (including gender dysphoria and similar gender-related conditions), sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation (including actual or perceived heterosexuality, homosexuality, bisexuality, and asexuality), veteran status, military status, domestic violence victim status, reproductive health decision making or any other protected category. In addition, Uniswap Labs participates in E-Verify. You can view the E-Verify poster here and the Right to Work poster here.

As a dedicated frontend hire, you will gain ownership over our existing suite of web products, as well as the ability to influence the creation, design, and execution of future products. You will be responsible for ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience across trading interfaces, data-heavy analytics pages, documentation portals and more.
 
Responsibilities

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with the web3 frontend stack (ethers.js/web3.js, EIP-1193, client-side private key management, etc.)

  • Love for unicorns :)

Minimum full-time salary of $220,000-$240,000. Disclosure in accordance with New York City's Pay Transparency Law. Full Time employees at Uniswap Labs are also eligible for other compensation elements, including equity, tokens, and benefits, dependent on the position type.

We're looking for an experienced engineering manager to help us grow our world-class protocol engineering team. You will focus on the people and process of Uniswap Labs engineering so that we can continue to ship great technical work. You're excited to support engineers and help them reach their full potential.
 
Responsibilities
  • Directly manage individual contributor engineers
  • Ensure the engineering team is able to deliver quality projects at a fast pace
  • Provide career growth advice and performance feedback
  • Focus on improving team processes
  • Recruit and hire new engineers to the team
  • Collaborate with product and design to deliver a roadmap

  • Experience growing and managing a deeply technical team of engineers
  • High emotional intelligence
  • Technical knowledge to discuss issues, approaches, and solutions in depth

  • Interest in crypto and basic Solidity exposure

Nice to Have

  • Full-time experience in the Web3/crypto space
  • Willingness to work out of our NYC office regularly

  • Previous experience with common dev tools in the space - Solidity, Ethers, etc

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated engineering intern to help us build the next generation of financial products. As an intern, you will get a chance to touch all parts of our stack and rapidly launch features along the way. You will be part of all the conversations from idea, design and execution. You will be responsible (with support from a mentor) for ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience across trading interfaces, data-heavy analytics pages, documentation portals and more.
 
Location and timing: The internship will take place in New York City over 12 weeks during the summer of 2023. 
 
Responsibilities
  • Work closely with design, product and rest of engineering to deliver production ready features
  • Own as much of the stack end to end as you demonstrate capacity for or deep dive into a specific area to become an expert

Requirements

  • Genuine excitement to learn and contribute to DeFi and Uniswap
  • Experience (either personal projects or paid) with some of the DeFi/crypto tools
  • Experience with one of React/Redux, Node, TypeScript, Python, or Solidity

Nice to Have

  • 2024 grad or 2+ summers of relevant internship experience
  • Studying towards a degree in Computer Science or related-field
  • Past internship at a well-respected engineering organization
  • Love for unicorns :)

As an HR Business Partner you partner directly with senior leadership in all strategic areas of Human Resources; your primary role will be to align our People, Talent and Culture priorities with our business objectives.  You will play a key role in supporting our rapidly growing organization and provide a world-class experience to our talented team. 

What you will do:

  • Oversee the strategic development and direction of all HR related projects and processes
  • Support leadership through organizational change and be the driver of new processes or frameworks
  • Be a model of our culture and exemplify our values with every interaction, both internally and externally
  • Act as a coach to leadership; helping them to solve people/talent/culture related topics and challenges
  • Through a deep understanding of our business, participate in organizational design and development planning 
  • Run performance management cycles; advising on all areas of performance including career development, compensation, leveling, and mentoring

Who you are:

  • A problem solver who takes the initiative to get to the root cause of an issue
  • A strategic thinker who has a vision for organizational improvements as the company continues to grow and scale
  • A trusted advisor who can support leadership and employees

What you have:

  • 7+ years of experience in HR/People Operations (at least 3 years as an HRBP)
  • An entrepreneurial mindsetAbility to see around corners and anticipate cross-functional issues before they arise 
  • Sound judgment and discretion
  • Approachability  
  • Ability to influence at all levels of an organization
  • High degree of empathy
  • Change management skills

Responsibilities:

  • Lead discussions with product and design to rapidly iterate, experiment and launch products
  • Design and build systems with an eye for performance & scalability
  • Own products end to end and work across the stack as needed, including backend, infrastructure, UI, testing, etc.
  • Mentor team members on engineering best practices and career development

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience 
  • Experience building and maintaining a production system at scale 
  • Experience with AWS, GCP or similar cloud providers 
  • Deep understanding of the architecture of modern applications
  • Experience leading and aligning cross-functional stakeholders such as designers, engineers, and product managers to launch products 
  • Desire to keep up with modern best practices in software development/Web3, and shape our tech stack as we build out new systems and services 

Nice to have:

  • Love for unicorns :)

We’re looking for great engineers and storytellers to build the platforms, communities and experiences that get the next 1 million developers building on the Uniswap Protocol.

As our the Developer Relations Lead, you’ll lay the foundation for this vision, building development tools and platforms, establishing strong relationships with the developer community and translating their needs into products that create the best Developer Experience in Web3.

If you’re passionate about growing the Web3/crypto community, building world class developer experiences, trying out new technologies and sharing what you’ve learned, we’d love to chat!

Responsibilities:

  • Champion the Uniswap Protocol by building next generation developer tools, high-quality sample applications, demos, technical documentation, tutorials and being an engineering thought leader in the community
  • Drive adoption of the Uniswap developer products to grow the ecosystem of DeFi apps, integrations, and services built on top of the Uniswap Protocol
  • Identify opportunities to engage with developers and grow our community in-person and online, from speaking at conferences to hosting office hours on Twitter or Discord
  • Raise the bar for our documentation by working alongside engineers, product managers, and technical writers

Requirements:

  • You're a creative engineer who enjoys working on a large set of technologies, from writing React components to smart contracts in Solidity
  • Have a passion for building delightful developer experiences and vibrant developer communities
  • Strong communication skills, and the ability to convey complex topics simply to a large developer audience
  • Passionate about Ethereum, DeFi, and Web3/crypto

Nice to have:

  • Prior experience creating a Developer Relations program, writing technical articles, and building open source software
  • Experience with Ethereum/Solidity or other blockchains
  • Love for unicorns :)

Minimum full-time salary of $160,000-$200,000. Disclosure in accordance with New York City's Pay Transparency Law. Full Time employees at Uniswap Labs are also eligible for other compensation elements, including equity, tokens, and benefits, dependent on the position type.

Uniswap Protocol is an anchor in the DeFi space and EVM-based blockchains. Countless projects integrate with it today and many more are interested in building on top of it. Build the best experience for all of those developers to integrate at any level of the stack: Protocol, Smart Contracts, SDKs, and APIs.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with Product, Design and other members of the Engineering team to define and build an interactive developer experience across Uniswap Labsâ€™ portfolio
  • Build tools, SDKs, and documentation to help developers use Uniswap
  • Review existing offerings and be part of all new launches to ensure a high bar for documentation
  • Interact with developers in the Uniswap community to better understand their needs and solve their problems

Requirements:

  • Passionate and opinionated about developer tooling
  • Enjoy working across the stack, from frontend to backend with developers as the ultimate customers
  • Passion for explaining complicated subjects to a wide range of technical audiences
  • BS in CS or related field
  • 2+ years writing software

Nice to have:

  • Interested to engage with developers over Slack, Discord, Email, or hackathons
  • Experience working in Web3
  • Experience maintaining open source projectsLove for unicorns :)

We’re looking for an experienced engineering manager to help us create a world-class engineering team with a strong focus on instilling best coding practices, creating efficient processes, and shipping the best products for our users. In this role, you will be responsible for the evolution and maintenance of our flagship web app that serves as an interface to the Uniswap protocol. You will help us build delightful and intuitive experiences for our users as well as fortify the foundations of the app to ensure its continued stability. Join us!

Responsibilities:

  • Directly manage individual contributor frontend web engineers
  • Ensure the engineering team is able to deliver quality projects at a fast pace
  • Provide career growth advice and performance feedback
  • Focus on improving team processes
  • Recruit and hire new engineers to the team
  • Collaborate with product and design to deliver a roadmap

  • 2+ years of management experience growing & managing a team of engineers 
  • Previous experience in Web technologies

This role will collaborate with internal teams including community, marketing, product, engineering, design, and research. The SMM will manage multiple social campaigns simultaneously, use data driven strategies to reach users, and craft thoughtful strategies that will serve unique audiences.

The Social Media Manager must have strong relationships with key social media and digital platforms, as well as seek out emerging platforms that can help us reach our target demographics. The SMM must also be able to keep a pulse on our key audiences and cultivate relationships with members of the community.

Responsibilities

  • Drive our overall social strategy from concepting ideas, to coordinating among teams, to executing, to creatively bringing messages to life
  • Own content creation and execution from start to finish for all platforms, in coordination with multiple teams and while maintaining Uniswap's distinct brand tone
  • Coordinate across the organization to develop a deep understanding of product offerings and help plan innovative go-to-market plans for new announcements
  • Develop social media calendar for all platforms, which is integrated with communications and product timelines
  • Cultivate relationships with users across platforms
  • Identify growth opportunities across platforms
  • Run analytics and develop insights that are relevant to our core audiences and integrate findings into engagement planning

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of experience running multiple social media platforms for an organization or agency
  • Informed and passionate about crypto, DeFi, and Web3 as transformative opportunities
  • Proven ability to to use social media to maintain or build a brand, with experience in everything from explainer threads, to product marketing, to playful memes
  • Excellent copywriting skills and ability to develop and adapt tone of voice
  • Deep understanding of social media platforms, especially Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube
  • Experience with social analytics tools like Sprout Social to inform decision making
  • Graphic design experience and familiarity with basic design tools to create image content

Nice to Haves

  • Love for unicorns :)

As Community Lead you will play a pivotal role in shaping Uniswap’s presence in our users lives - fostering meaningful relationships with users and partners. Your primary responsibility will be to autonomously lead and execute user engagement strategies that resonate with our community, ensuring their engagement and loyalty. Target audience is the current community and larger Web3 ecosystem. You will be responsile for conceptualizing, planning, and executing our events and activations strategy that not only promote our products or services but also create memorable experiences for our users. With your knowledge and experience, capable of creatively unblocking and driving forward initiatives on your own. Additionally, you will oversee community engagement initiatives, ensuring that our users feel heard, valued, and connected with our brand. Your insights and data-driven approach will guide us in continuously improving our community engagement efforts, and you will play a key role in shaping our brand's narrative in the market. You will own and manage the budget for Community, including resource allocation, under the overarching guidance and goals of the Marketing team. Collaborating with external brand partners is another crucial aspect of your role, where you will identify and nurture partnerships that align with Uniswap values and enhance our reach. Your passion for community-building and your ability to strategize, execute, and measure the impact of your initiatives will be essential in driving our brand's success. You will mentor and be a partner to fellow Marketing & Uniswap team members, a role model of UNI-code values. ## Key Responsibilities Events & Activations Strategy and Execution - Given company goals, develop and execute events and IRL activations strategy for 2024. - Audit the entire landscape of potential events we could go to, work with leadership to determine which we want to prioritize and the strategy we want to leverage to show up - This includes reviewing international markets and events that align with our growth goals - Propose and manage budget, measure and report on agreed to KPIs for each activation. - Own execution of each event to the quality an caliber that the Uniswap brand warrants. Continue to evaluate learnings and iterate on strategy to achieve maximum results. - Actively engage in both online and in-person activities to promote our brand, including attending industry events, conferences, meetups, and webinars. - For events and conferences we decide not to produce experiences at, handle the different sponsorship and marketing opportunities we may want to consider. Own start to finish process from sourcing opportunities, exploring options, negotiating a deal, and seeing through execution User Engagement, Retention and Advocacy [Community Marketing] - Community Council: nurture brand evangelists; build out a program to engage with target groups of users; the aim is to turn fans into advocates - Design, execute, and monitor different campaigns around fostering a group of brand evangelists. Some subsets of community members we could craft campaigns towards include: Beta users / product feedback for different parts of the org, Developers (X and v4 focused), Industry leaders / influencers who have lots of reach, high volume traders - In q4 specifically, helping to lead a whale listening tour, and telegram marketing/outreach - Figure out right relationship with discord and developer community - Review the educational resources that exist for both our dev and non-dev community, make a recommendation around where we can improve the educational resources that exist for our community, and manage implementation of those resources (if any) ***depending on company goals*** - Host virtual community events: host twitter spaces, town halls, or other externally facing discussions where we can convey product information to our community, and where we can facilitate dialogue between our team and community members Marketing Partnerships - Maintain relationships with Web3 community managers, marketers and Key Opinion Leaders; keeping a finger on the pulse and identify opportunities to collaborate - Develop, manage and execute partner facing marketing campaigns when relevant to team goals. Think creatively and proactively to identify co-marketing opportunities with relevant Web3 projects, including main net foundations and web3 communities that can help drive brand awareness & trust, user growth and platform adoption - Identify brand marketing opportunities to bring Uniswap to new audiences while staying true to self. Execute 1-2 of these more stunt focused PR collaborations a year (think KidSuper)

job_title: Head of Policy (Europe, Middle East, and Africa)
job_description:
Uniswap Labs has helped develop three versions of the Uniswap protocol, which are essential infrastructure for self-custody wallets, web3 protocols, and digital asset trading. Our investors include Paradigm, Andreessen Horowitz, Union Square Ventures, and Variant. Our team includes refugees from Amazon, Blackrock, Coinbase, U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission, Google, the Federal Reserve, and Microsoft.

Uniswap Labs is at the forefront of the policy debate regarding the future of digital assets policy generally and decentralized finance (DeFi) and web3 more specifically. The Head of Public Policy EMEA would play a critical role in representing Uniswap Labs and the DeFi industry in policy discussions across EMEA. This person will have to be able to think through policy development, strategy, persuasion, team-building in order to be an effective policy engineer and advocate.

Location: London, Brussels, or other European capital

Responsibilities:

  • Policy development. Cryptocurrency regulation is still developing, and there are many divergent proposals and frameworks proposed across multiple policy areas. Working with other experts, the leader should have the capacity to craft frameworks, respond to them, evaluate them, and understand analogous regulatory precedents and how to modify or apply them.
  • Strategy. Political strategy requires understanding what goals to set and how to deploy time and resources to reach those goals to reach them. If we develop the optimal policy (#1 above), how may it be adopted? What are the timelines that matter? What are the legislative and regulatory opportunities to focus on, such as must-pass vehicles, rulemakings, or reports? Who needs to be persuaded, how, and to what effect? What is our request? Which allies are necessary to meet our goals. Too many people in political circles think a sound “strategy” is, “educate people.” This is one tactic among many–and must be employed towards a feasible goal benefiting the company.
  • Persuasion. Any policy (#1) and strategy (#2) requires educating and persuading the right people. It may involve persuading industry allies and associations, senior officials, and junior staffers. The leader will likely hire someone else, such as an outside firm or internal resource, to support “retail lobbying” on a day-to-day basis. But the leader should be able to understand what material may be persuasive to certain classes of audiences, and to direct the creation of persuasive material such as decks, charts, data, reports, one-pagers, etc. Further, the leader should preferably be able to handle the “high-end lobbying” in meetings with the most sophisticated thought leaders in senior positions of government and industry. Persuasion is not just intellect but also curiosity and passion–for cryptocurrency, open markets, decentralized finance, and/or technology.
  • Team-building. Being at the forefront of an emerging industry, UL will likely need to allocate sufficient resources to be a corporate leader in several policy domains and regional areas. The leader should have experience recruiting, building, and managing great teams to do great things, preferably across jurisdictions. Other A players should want to work with and for you.

Requirements:

  • At least 5 years in policy-related role focused on digital assets or financial services. Ideally 8+ years.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in English.

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience working in public sector in policymaking role at EU level or EU member national government or in the UK government or at an international policymaking body, e.g., FSB, IMF, IOSCO, etc. 
  • Love for the unicorns ðŸ¦„

Uniswap Labs is hiring a Research Lead who will work in a highly collaborative and cross-functional team setting to further our understanding of the protocol and product usage, and to contribute toward future innovations through research.Active areas of study include decentralized exchange market dynamics and participant behaviors, liquidity provision in decentralized exchanges, price improvement through novel mechanism design, and the monitoring and reduction of systemic risk.

Candidates must have strong curiosity and familiarity with the DeFi market, interest in applying research to application, and a desire to share knowledge broadly.

Responsibilities:

  • Work as an integral part of the business strategy, product, engineering and policy team and as a key cross-functional leader engaged with relevant stakeholders on Uniswap’s protocol, applications, and value proposition.
  • Establish Uniswap Labs as a thought leader in DeFi by contributing to cutting-edge research related to decentralized markets, market structure and market design.
  • Actively lead conversations with regulators, policy makers and traditional institutions to bridge DeFi to the mainstream.
  • Oversee collaboration with, and provide guidance to, third party researchers.
  • Lead and build a research & data science team that drives analyses to inform overall business strategy, product features, and future protocol developments.

Requirements:

  • A professor or Ph.D with at least 7+ years of research experience in market design, market structure or empirical financial economics.
  • A proven track record of thought leadership, such as academic publications in peer-reviewed journals, or significant contributions to policy discussions / market innovations.
  • Demonstrated abilities to engage in external conversations involving regulators, policy makers and institutional stakeholders.
  • Highly effective communications skills, including the ability to explain advanced technical concepts in an adaptive and relatable manner to different audiences.
  • Ability to manage a team of researchers and data scientists to deliver on multiple projects on different timelines.
  • Strong understanding of crypto market, DeFi, automated market making, decentralized exchanges.

 

Minimum full-time salary of $200,000-$250,000. Disclosure in accordance with New York City's Pay Transparency Law. Full Time employees at Uniswap Labs are also eligible for other compensation elements, including equity, tokens, and benefits, dependent on the position type.

While keeping a pulse on the product and company, they will predict future changes in business KPIs.

Responsibilities

  • Perform exploratory data analyses and build models to distill insights from data and identify new strategic opportunities
  • Partner with Product, Growth, Research, Engineering and Leadership to inform, influence, support and execute strategy and product and growth decisions
  • Design and analyze product experiments to guide product launches
  • Collaborate with multiple subject matter experts to drive new data initiatives, automate business intelligence reporting, and establish best practices

    • Both for product launches as well as ongoing marketing campaigns

Requirements

  • Ability to prioritize in a highly dynamic start-up environment
  • An inquisitive mindset and ability to tackle challenges with limited guidance

Nice to Have

We are seeking a Product Data Scientist who will work in a highly collaborative and cross-functional setting to empower data-driven decision-making at the company level. The successful candidate should possess exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to communicate results in a clear and concise manner. Specifically, they will use knowledge of causal inference and statistics to setup and evaluate experiments, advise the Uniswap Labs Product and Engineering teams on key drivers of user engagement, and suggest product and business (growth/marketing) improvements that can drive impact against Company Goals.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role has the option to be partially or fully remote.

Responsibilities

  • Develop core metrics and create dashboards to track and measure business performance
  • Design, conduct and analyze A/B tests to guide product decisions
  • Model production transformations of data to support analytics and reporting requirements (using tools like DBT / Dataflow)
  • Perform explorative data analyses and build models to distill insights from user behavior and identify new strategic opportunities
  • Partner with Product, Growth, Research, Engineering and Leadership to inform, influence, support and execute strategy and product and growth decisions
  • Collaborate with multiple subject matter experts to drive new data initiatives, automate business intelligence reporting, and establish best practices
  • Support growth and marketing teams in quantifying and measuring the performance and cost efficiency of marketing campaigns

  • Bachelors in quantitative field (CS, Stats, economics, etc) with 5+ years work experience in a data science role at a tech company, or Ph.D. in quantitative field with 3+ years data science work experience at a tech company
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python
  • Ability to develop and analyze algorithms to extract insights from large datasets
  • Strong statistical acumen with ability to interpret experiment results and set-up statistical tests from scratch as necessary
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to team members in other domains
  • Ability to prioritize in a highly dynamic start-up environment
  • An inquisitive mindset and ability to tackle challenges with limited guidance

Nice to Have

  • Experience with consumer-facing software
  • Experience with blockchain data and analytics tools
  • Experience with DeFi/web3
  • Fondness for the color pink

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, collaborative, and communicative senior product marketer to spearhead user research, develop detailed user personas, and drive the go-to-market strategy for key products.

This individual will work closely with our product, growth marketing, and content leads to bring new products to market, lead user and competitor research, and deliver creative, impactful, and relevant marketing campaigns.

This role requires a strong understanding of web2 and web3 marketing strategies, exceptional writing skills, experience with product positioning, user segmentation, and the ability to drive on creative messaging. This role is responsible for collaborating cross-functionally to ensure that each feature update and launch is moving the needle for Uniswap

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role will be NYC based.

Responsibilities 

  • User Research:

    • Design and Execute Research: Lead planning and conduct both qualitative and quantitative research initiatives to develop and continuously refine detailed Uniswap retail user personas.

    • Content Creation: Develop targeted marketing collateral for various touchpoints, such as events, social media channels, and community platforms like Telegram.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated engineer to help us build the next generation of financial products. This role’s primary focus will be on the Uniswap Wallet suite of products, which consists of mobile apps on iOS and Android as well as our new browser extension. Our products live in a monorepo and are built using React Native for Web to enable maximal code sharing between them.

As a Staff Engineer at Uniswap, you will be expected to drive a large degree of impact by being involved in multiple key projects, exemplify engineering excellence, and be a strong source of mentorship for more junior engineers. You will be responsible for ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience across these interfaces and will have the ability to influence the creation, design, and execution of future products and features. 

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role has the option to be partially or fully remote.

Responsibilities

  • Work across client, server, architecture, and infrastructure that powers our wallet products
  • Take charge of driving strategic technical initiatives across engineering pods that impact the entire engineering organization
  • Play a leading technical role in multiple large, impactful projects
  • Rapidly implement functional UI elements from design mocks, with an eye toward performance and accessibility and ensure that components are functional, elegant, and performant
  • Know when to create abstractions vs. one-off features
  • Provide mentorship and feedback to other engineers on the team through both code and design doc reviews

Requirements

  • 8+ years of software engineering experience
  • A deep understanding of the architecture of modern client-side React Native applications
  • Proven individual contributor or previously a Tech Lead with experience planning and leading end to end large projects with long-term impact on one or more systems or a team
  • Familiarity with the web3 frontend stack (e.g., ethers.js, web3.js, viem)
  • Experience with TypeScript
  • Experience working fullstack
  • A desire to keep up with modern best practices in web/mobile development

Nice to Have

  • Experience in native mobile (e.g., Swift, Kotlin)
  • Experience with React Native for Web
  • Degree in computer science
  • Prior experience creating a design system or component library
  • Love for unicorns :)

As the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Manager, you will play a crucial role in driving our financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis by working closely with Finance, Accounting, and the company’s Functional Leads. This position offers unique visibility across the entire company, allowing you to serve as the key liaison between multiple departments and teams. You will transform your analyses into deep insights, communicate these findings to key stakeholders and leaders, and support strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate will have experience in the blockchain space, possess excellent financial modeling skills, and thrive in a high-growth environment.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role will be NYC based.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct forecasting, budgeting, and month-end close reporting and analysis
  • Maintain and update the company's financial model
  • Work cross-functionally across the company to create accurate forecasts, optimize spend, and review historical data
  • Develop and maintain financial dashboards and reports
  • Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis to support strategic decision making
  • Identify and understand business challenges and propose data-driven solutions
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in the blockchain and crypto space

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field; MBA preferred
  • 5+ years of experience in financial planning and analysis, preferably in the blockchain or tech industry

  • Excellent financial modeling skills and proficiency in Excel
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical teams
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment
  • "Roll up the sleeves" mentality and willingness to take on any task, big or small, to contribute to the company's success

  • CFA, CPA, or other relevant professional certifications
  • Experience with ERP systems and financial planning software
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment
  • Knowledge of data analytics and programming languages such as SQL and Python

Uniswap Labs is seeking a Research Data Scientist, who will work in a highly collaborative and cross-functionally team setting to further our understanding of the protocol and product usage, and to contribute toward future product innovations through research. Active areas of study include deepening understanding of liquidity demand and provision in decentralized exchanges, quantifying and predicting behaviors of different market participant, design mechanisms to prevent and deter market manipulation and reduce systemic risk. Candidates must have strong curiosity to drive understanding in DeFi, interest in applying research to application, and desire to share knowledge broadly.

Candidates should have familiarity the Uniswap Protocol, and its surrounding ecosystem of products, and DeFi/web3. Additionally, candidates should have strong communication skills and be capable of sharing their work with members across the team.Â 


What You Will Do:
  • Systematically test and expand hypotheses to shape protocol and product improvements
  • Develop statistical and machine learning models to understand and predict market participant behaviors and interaction with other protocols in DeFi
  • Source data and implementing metrics that further understanding of products across the Uniswap ecosystem
  • Work on self-directed and collaborative research projects that contribute to future product innovations
  • Collaborate with internal and external researchers to study and elucidate protocol usage and associated market dynamics


Requirements:
  • Bachelors/Masters/Ph.D. in quantitative fields (CS, Stats, economics, etc) with 2+ years work experience
  • Experience in processing, analyzing, and reporting on financial or consumer product data
  • Experience with SQL and Python/C++
  • An inquisitive mindset and ability to tackle challenges with limited guidance
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to team members across other domains
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a deeply collaborative work environment
  • Experience in financial services/startups/tech


Nice to Have:
  • Experience within DeFi/web3
  • Experience in a research role that applies scientific rigor to solve complex problems in an area of domain expertise
  • Experience with blockchain data and analytics tools
  • Fondness for the color pink

Zoom out to synthesize insights into relevant actionable feedback for the business, product and engineering teams.

job_description:
The Uniswap Labs team is building products to unlock value through universal exchange. We envision a future where digital economies flourish, and markets are transparent, global, and equitable.

Our products – the Uniswap Interface, the Uniswap Mobile App, and the Uniswap Extension – are powered by the Uniswap Protocol and Uniswap Platform. The protocol is the largest onchain marketplace, with billions of dollars in weekly volume across thousands of tokens on Ethereum and 8+ additional chains.

When you join Uniswap, you become part of a team that's reshaping the way value flows on the internet.

About the role

The Uniswap API team mission is to Unlock universal ownership and exchange at scale via our suite of trading and data APIs. These APIs power both Uniswap Labs apps, which support billions of dollars in trading volume each week, as well as a growing number of external integrators. 

We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to build out and scale usage of these industry leading API products. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience building and scaling enterprise platform products. They will also have excellent communication and leadership skills enabling them to work effectively across functional teams. 

Uniswap Labs is headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role is ideally NYC based.

Responsibilities

  • Lead product strategy and vision across internal and external Uniswap API products. Drive cross-functional milestones towards realization of that vision, and a mentor and strong collaborator on the API product team.
  • Define a world-class developer experience and lead initiatives to achieve it.
  • Use metrics, industry trends, and customer insights to identify and execute new growth opportunities for our Platform API products.
  • Partner closely with business development to own the relationship with external Uniswap API customers and partners

Requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent job experience as a software engineer or product manager building facing developer products
  • 6+ years of product management experience building B2B or enterprise facing platforms
  • Strong communication and writing skills
  • Ability to influence and drive alignment with senior Leadership and Business Stakeholders, taking in differing perspectives & translating into action
  • Experience building, executing and prioritizing in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience leveraging data to build products and solve user needs
  • Strong interest in the Crypto/blockchain space

Nice to haves:

  • Prior experience building in the crypto or fintech product space

Intro paragraph/ about the role: 

As a People Team Project Manager at Uniswap, you will play a pivotal role in coordinating People team programs that enhance team member experience. Your responsibilities will include managing projects related to engagement, performance, and organizational development. You will collaborate closely with fellow members of the People team to ensure alignment with Uniswap's goals, develop and implement project plans, and track progress to ensure timely and successful delivery. The ideal candidate will have a background in project management, excellent communication skills, and a passion for fostering a positive and inclusive workplace culture.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role will be NYC based.

Responsibilities

In partnership with HRBP and People Ops, support in the following areas for all People programs. Programs include, feedback and engagement cycles, learning & development, team events & on sites, compensation, DEI, employee relations, and team design. 

  • Project Coordination: Assist in the planning and coordination of People team activities, ensuring all tasks are completed on time and within scope.
  • Communication: Maintain clear and effective communication with team members and stakeholders, providing updates on project status and any issues that arise.
  • Task Management: Track and manage project-related tasks, ensuring team members are participating in programs and alert HRBP if engagement is low.
  • Documentation: Prepare and maintain project documentation, including meeting notes, progress reports, and project plans.
  • Support Senior Managers: Provide support to senior project managers by helping with administrative tasks, data collection, and report generation.
  • Resource Scheduling: Assist in scheduling resources, including personnel and equipment, to ensure project tasks are adequately staffed and equipped.
  • Workshop Coordination: Organize and coordinate sessions for team members, in partnership with HRBP & People Ops.
  • Increase impact through data: Help identify potential project issues and areas of improvement through data, and suggest strategies to improve the program. 
  • Continuous Improvement: Gather feedback from team members and stakeholders to identify areas for improvement in project processes and workflows. 

Requirements:

  • Ability to analyze data and generate reports.
  • Critical thinking skills to identify issues and recommend solutions.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships and work collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
  • Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities, including identifying issues, proposing solutions, and implementing corrective actions.

Nice to haves:

  • Entry-level project management certification such as CAPM (Certified Associate in Project Management) and/or HR-related certification such as SHRM-CP or PHR.
  • Familiarity with HRIS and other HR-related software (eg Lattice).

Conclusion

We’re looking for an experienced Executive Assistant to support our COO at Uniswap Labs. While mainly focused on the COO, this role will work closely with the executive team and leaders across the company.

Successful candidates are organized, thorough, adaptable, and patient. They’ll handle essential EA tasks—scheduling, drafting emails, and managing daily support—with care and precision. They bring a positive attitude, act as a liaison, confidant and accountability partner. Given access to sensitive information, professionalism and discretion are a must.

By managing the daily details, this role empowers our execs to focus on big-picture work, making the EA essential to our team’s success.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City, and this role will be in-person and NYC based.

Responsibilities:

Calendar & Meeting Management

  • Manage the COO’s calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and events.
  • Triage and prioritize meeting requests based on importance and relevance.
  • Collect and organize agenda items, ensuring the executive has reviewed all prep materials in advance. Follow up with partners & team members to ensure meetings have an agenda & materials shared in advance. 
  • Help the COO prioritize calendar & commitments.
  • Keep the executive on time throughout the day and follow up with meeting attendees on action items or resources as needed.

Administrative Support

  • Take minutes during select meetings, create follow up actions. 
  • Arrange catering and logistics for meetings at the office.
  • Arrange monthly dinners at the COO’s home or restaurants for key partners and investors. 
  • Coordinate and receive lunch daily. 
  • Welcome guests to the office.
  • Arrange travel according to executive preferences, may travel with COO to meetings & events. Process reimbursements, as needed.

Email & Communication Management

  • Manage the COO’s email inbox in collaboration with team partners.
  • Triage emails, draft responses, and flag urgent requests for the COO's attention.

Liaison

  • Act as a point of contact between the COO and internal team members, external partners, customers, and stakeholders.
  • Represent the COO and Uniswap Labs with discretion and professionalism.

Confidant & Partner

  • Serve as a trusted partner, handling confidential information with discretion.
  • Proactively identify opportunities for improvement and implement solutions, involving team members as necessary.
  • As time permits, take on small to medium-impact projects in service of the COO or their team. Able to accurately utilize data, and knowledge of Unsiwap Labs. 

Personal Assistance (25% of Time)

  • Arrange lunch daily, assist with personal errands, such as shipping packages or coordinating home services.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role.
  • Excellent organization, time management and prioritization skills 
  • Demonstrated problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset to fix problems as they arise
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build rapport and trust with internal and external stakeholders
  • Proven track record handling sensitive information with discretion.
  • Strong written & verbal communication skills.

Nice to haves

  • Love of Unicorns

Our products live in a monorepo and are built using React Native for Web to enable maximal code sharing between them.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Engineering Manager to lead our Security and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams. This role is crucial in ensuring the security, reliability, and efficiency of our infrastructure and applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both security engineering and site reliability, with proven leadership abilities and a passion for fostering a culture of security and reliability across the organization.

We are headquartered in SoHo, New York City, and this role can be partially or fully remote.

Key Responsibilities

Leadership and Management:

  • Lead and mentor a team of security engineers and site reliability engineers, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Develop and execute strategies for improving security and reliability across all systems and services.
  • Set clear goals and performance metrics for the team, conducting regular performance reviews and providing constructive feedback.

Security Engineering:

  • Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of security measures across the organizationâ€™s infrastructure and applications.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
  • Conduct regular security assessments, vulnerability testing, and threat modeling to identify and mitigate risks.
  • Develop and maintain security policies, procedures, and best practices.

Site Reliability Engineering:

  • Manage the reliability, availability, and performance of the companyâ€™s services and infrastructure.
  • Implement and maintain monitoring, alerting, and incident response processes.
  • Optimize system performance and automate repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
  • Drive continuous improvement in operational processes and engineering practices to enhance system reliability.

Collaboration and Communication:

  • Collaborate with other engineering teams, product managers, and stakeholders to ensure security and reliability requirements are integrated into all stages of the development lifecycle.
  • Communicate effectively with senior management and other departments, providing regular updates on security and reliability initiatives and performance.
  • Advocate for security and reliability best practices throughout the organization.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 7+ years of experience in security engineering and/or site reliability engineering, with at least 3 years in a leadership or management role.
  • Strong understanding of security principles, practices, and technologies, including encryption, authentication, access control, and network security.
  • Proven experience with reliability engineering practices such as monitoring, alerting, incident response, and performance tuning.
  • Proficiency in scripting and automation tools, such as Python, Bash, Ansible, or Terraform.
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and container orchestration systems (Kubernetes, Docker).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and inspire teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or SANS GIAC.
  • Experience with DevOps practices and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, GitOps, and infrastructure as code.
  • Knowledge of compliance frameworks such as GDPR, HIPAA, or SOC 2.

We’re looking for a curious, creative, and analytical growth marketing specialist to identity and test into new growth opportunities across Uniswap’s portfolio of products.

The individual will work closely with product, data, and content marketing leads to research new marketing strategies, propose initial tests and GTM plans, and execute and report on their findings. This role requires a strong understanding of web2 marketing strategy, tactical ownership experience over marketing channels (paid / content / other), strong writing skills, excellency in data analytics, and an interest in crypto. This role is responsible for maintaining and adding to our backlog of marketing experiments, channels, and growth tactics aimed at driving user acquisition, activation, and engagement.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role has the option to be partially or fully remote.

Responsibilities

  • Own the growth marketing testing roadmap to identify new channels and strategies across the Uniswap platform, from opportunity sizing all the way through launch
  • Launch test campaigns into new paid acquisition channels like influencers & affiliates
  • Collaborate with PDE to identify opportunities for growth across SEO and product-led growth (PLG)
  • Work alongside Product & Content teams to develop our lifecycle marketing strategy across email, push, and in-app notifications
  • Build out app store optimization (ASO) testing roadmap and perform regular optimizations
  • Deliver in-depth weekly reporting & analysis for all channels under ownership
  • Contribute to Go To Market channel strategy and execution for new strategic releases

Requirements

  • 5 years of marketing experience working with technical B2C products, with a strong background in 1-2 core channels
  • Passionate about working at the cross-section of quantitative and creative marketing
  • Obsessed with crypto, DeFi, and Web3 as transformative opportunities, with personal or professional experience using a self-custody wallet, engaging with dApps, NFTs, or participating in DAOs
  • Incredibly clear written communication and desire to document everything
  • Very organized, able to stay on top of several moving projects at once
  • Experience with A/B & multivariate testing and a solid understanding of statistics
  • Understanding of product & marketing KPIs like LTV, ARPU, and ROAS

About the Role

We’re looking for a detail-oriented, creative content marketer to join the team!

The Content Marketer will help to develop and execute content strategies that drive engagement, growth, and support our overall marketing goals. This person will be responsible for creating, managing, and optimizing a variety of content across different channels and mediums (including blogs, learning resources, product landing pages, and more).

The person in this role is dedicated to making complex concepts simple, focusing on the user, and always starting with “why”. You’ll also act as a steward for the Uniswap brand across the organization, helping field copy requests and other types of content requests across the Marketing team.

As the Uniswap brand expands to more and more users, we’re excited to bring someone on who helps us scale how and where we tell our story to new audiences. ðŸ¦„

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role will be NYC based.

Responsibilities

Content Execution

  • Develop on engaging educational content that simplifies complex concepts to users that are new to crypto and Uniswap Labs’ products
  • Support the Growth Marketing team on creating content for landing pages, blog articles, web pages, in-product notifications, banner ads, and more
  • Improve SEO performance of existing blogs, support articles, and landing pages through content updates & technical optimization, in tandem with Growth Marketer & Customer Experience teams
  • Monitor and report out on weekly performance of new and existing content pieces
  • Work closely with the Content team to ensure alignment and consistency across all product content and copywriting

Content Strategy

  • Collaborate with Content team to research and implement strategies for launching in and growing audiences on net new organic channels like Reddit and/or YouTube
  • Research and analyze trends, preferences, and pain points to help guide content strategy

Copywriting

  • Learn and adopt the Uniswap voice, creating simple, user-centric copy that embodies Uniswap's values and positioning
  • Collaborate with the broader Marketing and Design teams to create ad hoc collateral for a variety of activations including campaigns, events, partnerships, and more
  • Demonstrate flexibility and skill in writing a wide variety of copy, including paid ads, blog posts, product copy, and creative one-off projects.

Requirements

Must haves

  • Strong written communication skills
  • 2+ years of experience working as a content marketer, copywriter, or journalist
  • Be a no-task-too-big, no-task-too-small team member
  • Strong time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record to execute against deliverables
  • NYC-based
  • Experience working with agencies and contractors to build content for brands
  • Familiarity with Contentful, Framer, Google Search Console, and other comparable marketing platforms
  • Attention to detail and high bar for quality
  • Passion for bringing new audiences onchain

Nice to haves

  • Experience creating short-form and/or long-form educational video content
  • Experience developing video screen-capture content, static screenshots, GIFs
  • Experience working in international markets or on content internationalization efforts
  • Deep understanding of the crypto ecosystem

We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Tech Lead to spearhead our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team. As the Tech Lead, you will be responsible for establishing and maintaining the reliability, performance, and efficiency of our systems. You will play a crucial role in building and shaping the SRE team, driving best practices, and collaborating closely with other engineering teams to ensure our services are robust and scalable.

We are headquartered in SoHo, New York City, and this role can be partially or fully remote.

Key Responsibilities

Reliability and Performance:

  • Design, implement, and maintain systems and processes that enhance the reliability, availability, and performance of our services.
  • Design, implement and maintain CICD tools and processes to increase reliability
  • Design, implement and maintain cloud constructs to increase reliability
  • Develop and manage monitoring, alerting, and incident response strategies to minimize downtime and ensure rapid recovery from incidents.
  • Conduct root cause analysis of system failures and implement preventative measures.
  • Optimize system performance and automate repetitive tasks to improve operational efficiency.

Team Leadership:

  • Foster a collaborative and high-performance team culture.
  • Set technical direction and priorities for the SRE team.
  • Conduct regular code and design reviews to maintain high standards of reliability and performance.
  • Lead, mentor, and grow a team of Site Reliability Engineers.

Collaboration and Communication:

  • Work closely with software engineering, infrastructure, and product teams to integrate reliability practices into the development lifecycle.
  • Advocate for SRE best practices and foster a culture of reliability and operational excellence across the organization.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders, providing regular updates on reliability metrics, incidents, and improvement initiatives.

Innovation and Improvement:

  • Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies in SRE, reliability, and performance.
  • Continuously evaluate and improve existing systems and processes to enhance reliability and efficiency.
  • Drive the adoption of new tools and technologies that can improve operational capabilities.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in site reliability engineering, DevOps, or a related field, with at least 2 years in a leadership or senior technical role.
  • Strong understanding of reliability engineering principles, practices, and tools.
  • Proficiency in monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Nagios).
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and container orchestration systems (Kubernetes, Docker).
  • Proficiency in scripting and automation tools, such as Python, Bash, Ansible, or Terraform.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and lead teams.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices and tools.
  • Knowledge of configuration management tools (e.g., Puppet, Chef).
  • Experience with database management and optimization.
  • Familiarity with compliance frameworks and security best practices.
  • Relevant certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Google Professional SRE, or equivalent.

Uniswap Labs is seeking an experienced commercial contracts attorney. The attorney must be team-oriented and well versed in contract law and industry best practices to inform contract drafting and negotiation strategies. The attorney will represent Uniswap Labs in communications with external parties.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City, and this role has the option to be partially or fully remote.

Responsibilities

  • Owning and managing all contract lifecycle processes, including tracking key milestones, renewals, and amendments, and maintaining accurate records in contract management systems.
  • Structuring, drafting, negotiating and reviewing a variety of commercial contracts including, but not limited, to vendor agreements, service agreements, licensing agreements, collaboration agreements and consulting agreements. 
  • Providing legal guidance and support to various team members on contractual matters, ensuring compliance with company policies and applicable laws and regulations.
  • Leading collaborative efforts with cross-functional teams, such as product, engineering, and business development, to facilitate contract negotiations and resolve contractual disputes in a timely manner. 
  • Driving improvements to contract lifecycle processes and operations. Developing and maintaining contract templates, standard clauses, and other legal resources to streamline the contract review and negotiation process.

Requirements:

  • JD degree (or foreign equivalent) with good standing in at least one US state bar.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in commercial contracts.
  • Extensive experience drafting, negotiating and reviewing complex commercial contracts.
  • Strong understanding of contract law principles and commercial transactions.
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize workload in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent judgment and the ability to make smart decisions in the face of ambiguity and imperfect information.
  • Strong communication (both written and verbal) and project management skills with a strict attention to detail.

Nice to haves:

  • Experience at an AM Law 100 corporate law firm, and/or working with companies in the technology and/or emerging company space.
  • Experience with drafting intellectual property focused agreements, particularly licenses.
  • Experience implementing, maintaining, and improving contract lifecycle processes.
  • A strong understanding of the Web3/crypto ecosystem.
