We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Analytics Engineer to join our dynamic data engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing our data analytics infrastructure to support our data-driven decision-making processes. This role requires deep technical expertise, a passion for working with data, and strong analytical skills.

Key Responsibilities

Data Infrastructure Development:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
  • Implement data integration solutions to consolidate data from various sources, ensuring data quality and integrity.
  • Optimize data storage and retrieval processes for performance and scalability.

Analytics and Reporting:

  • Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business analytics and decision-making.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide robust solutions.
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategy.

Data Quality and Governance:

  • Implement data validation and monitoring processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
  • Establish and enforce data governance policies and best practices.
  • Conduct regular audits and data quality assessments to identify and resolve data issues.

Collaboration and Communication:

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and business teams, to understand data requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
  • Communicate complex data insights and technical details to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior data engineers and analysts.

Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay current with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and analytics.
  • Continuously evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to improve data processing, analysis, and visualization capabilities.
  • Drive the adoption of best practices in data engineering and analytics across the organization.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data engineering, data analytics, or a related field.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
  • Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake).
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Scala.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes, data modeling, and data warehousing concepts.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Knowledge of machine learning and data science techniques.
  • Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies (e.g., Kafka, Flink).
  • Relevant certifications in data engineering or analytics.

We are looking for a Staff Accountant to play a crucial role in ensuring timely delivery of our monthly financial statements. The Staff Accountant will work closely with the Accounting Manager to ensure that our financial statements and supporting workpapers are accurate and complete. You will ensure financial data is properly captured, review monthly activity for accuracy and completeness, and provide insights into monthly fluctuations of balance sheet and income statement. This role offers a unique opportunity to engage with diverse teams, managing detailed financial data, systems and processes in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will have experience in digital asset accounting, demonstrate a strong understanding of generally accepted accounting principles, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

We are headquartered in SoHo in New York City, and this role has the option to be partially or fully remote.

Responsibilities

  • Oversee the accounts payable process, ensuring timely and accurate payments, resolving discrepancies, and maintaining strong relationships with vendors.
  • Manage employee spending by reviewing credit card transactions for compliance, resolving discrepancies, and ensuring adherence to internal policies and guidelines.
  • Conduct detailed financial statement reviews, identifying inconsistencies, ensuring accuracy, and providing actionable insights to support financial reporting.
  • Assist in the first pass of coding digital asset transactions, ensuring proper classification, compliance, and integration into the financial reporting system.
  • Prepare comprehensive supporting schedules within established guidelines for internal management review and facilitate audits by providing accurate and transparent documentation to external auditors.

 

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
  • 3+ years of relevant experience 
  • In-depth understanding of GAAP and financial statements (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement)
  • Advanced Excel User
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment

Nice to haves:

  • Big 4 Experience
  • Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
  • Systems knowledge: NetSuite, Ramp, Bill, Navan, Zip
  • Web3/crypto industry experience

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Staff Application Security Engineer to take on a technical leadership role within our organization. You will be responsible for driving the security of our applications, mentoring a team of security engineers, and ensuring our software products are robust against security threats. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of application security principles, a proven track record of implementing security best practices, and strong leadership skills.

Key Responsibilities

Technical Leadership:

  • Lead the application security team, setting technical direction and priorities.
  • Mentor and guide junior security engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
  • Conduct regular code reviews and security audits to ensure high standards of security practices are maintained.

Application Security:

  • Design, implement, and maintain security measures for our software applications to protect against threats and vulnerabilities.
  • Understand browser based attack vectors as well as android and iOS attack vectors
  • Understand cryptographic primitive and their security applications
  • Perform threat modeling, security code reviews, and vulnerability assessments.
  • Develop and maintain secure coding guidelines and best practices for developers.
  • Work closely with development teams to integrate security into the software development lifecycle (SDLC).

Incident Response and Management:

  • Lead incident response efforts for application security incidents, including investigation, mitigation, and post-incident analysis.
  • Develop and maintain incident response plans and procedures.
  • Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent future incidents.

Collaboration and Communication:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and infrastructure teams, to ensure comprehensive security coverage.
  • Communicate security risks, vulnerabilities, and requirements to stakeholders effectively.
  • Advocate for security best practices and foster a security-first mindset across the organization.

Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay current with the latest security trends, vulnerabilities, and technologies.
  • Evaluate and implement new security tools and technologies to enhance our security posture.
  • Continuously improve security processes and practices to ensure robust and scalable security solutions.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 7+ years of experience in application security or related fields, with at least 3 years in a leadership or senior technical role.
  • Deep understanding of application security principles, practices, and technologies.
  • Experience with security testing tools and methodologies (e.g., static and dynamic analysis, penetration testing).
  • Proficiency in programming and scripting languages (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript).
  • Strong knowledge of web application security standards (e.g., OWASP Top Ten, SANS/CWE Top 25).
  • Experience with cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP) and container security (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and lead teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CEH, OSCP, or CSSLP.
  • Experience with DevSecOps practices and tools.
  • Knowledge of regulatory compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS).
  • Experience with identity and access management (IAM) and authentication protocols (OAuth, SAML).

Role Overview:

We are seeking a strategic, data-driven, and resourceful Business Operations (BizOps) Manager to join our growing team. Reporting to the Head of BizOps, this role offers the unique opportunity to lead and execute high-impact initiatives end-to-end. The ideal candidate is skilled in strategic planning, cross-functional collaboration, and data analysis, with a strong ability to communicate actionable insights clearly and effectively. The BizOps Manager will work with a passionate and talented team at the forefront of financial industry innovation. This is an opportunity to work on challenging, novel, high-impact problems at the intersection of technology and finance.

Uniswap Labs is headquartered in SoHo in New York City and this role is ideally NYC based.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategic Leadership: Drive multiple strategic initiatives from scoping to implementation, aligning with Uniswap Labs' goals and broader company strategy
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Act as a central point of coordination, ensuring effective communication and alignment across teams and executives. Soliciting and appreciating different perspectives especially when those opinions are counter to their own
  • Data-Driven Insights: Conduct advanced data analyses merging on- and off-chain data to uncover key insights about business performance and strategic opportunities.
  • Revenue Modeling: Work closely with the FP&A team to own the company’s revenue model, keeping it updated with knowledge of key revenue drivers and new revenue streams to produce growth insights.
  • Communication: Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders, delivering insights in a clear, actionable, and impactful manner.

The Chief of Staff is a strategic and operational leader, supporting the Chief Operating Officer (COO) in driving company-wide planning, cross-functional coordination, and executive-level initiatives. This role focuses on adding structure, managing processes, and ensuring alignment across teams to achieve company goals. The Chief of Staff will also act as a key representative for the COO, guiding informed decisions, writing on their behalf, and fostering a culture of trust and collaboration.

Responsibilities

Strategic Planning & Execution

  • Lead annual and quarterly planning, ensuring all teams are aligned with strategic goals.
  • Track and monitor goals/roadmaps to ensure alignment with Uniswap mission & strategy.
  • Facilitate cross-functional coordination, resolving dependencies and bottlenecks.
  • Collaborate with department heads to drive execution and accountability.
  • Be a positive force for operational excellence, improving company and cross-functional velocity through collaboration, communication and process

Executive Support & Communication

  • Prepare the COO for policy and business development meetings, offering market and partner context, data + insights and key talking points.
  • Represent the COO in meetings, ensuring their voice and perspective are accurately reflected.
  • Draft communications and documents on behalf of the COO, maintaining consistency in tone and messaging.
  • Support the COO in making real-time decisions to move projects forward efficiently.

Cross-Functional Leadership & Project Management

  • Act as a trusted partner across teams, building influence and trust through transparency, integrity, and reliability, and ensuring smooth communication and collaboration.
  • Serve as a neutral facilitator in discussions, ensuring balanced input and clear outcomes.
  • Set up, structure, and drive new commercial projects from conception to handoff or completion, such as new products or partnerships, with internal teams until realization or stead
  • Make informed, real-time decisions to address challenges and keep projects on track, tactfully adjust strategies as needed to meet evolving business needs.

Requirements

  • 8+ years of experience in operations, strategy, business development or a similar role, preferably in a high-growth environment.
  • Strong track record of leading cross-functional initiatives and managing company-wide planning.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to write and represent executive leadership effectively.
  • Excellent judgment, decision-making skills, and the ability to facilitate discussions and build consensus.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

We believe in the power of data to drive our decision-making and are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Marketing Analytics team and help scale our impact.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Partner with stakeholders to frame business challenges and develop data models that inform acquisition and retention strategies.
  • Design and implement predictive models and marketing frameworks, analyzing customer cohorts to track KPIs such as LTV, CAC, and churn.

  • Build and maintain essential reporting tools to monitor the performance of marketing campaigns, including attribution models, media mix models, and cohort analysis.
  • Expand the company’s marketing analytics capabilities, integrating advanced techniques such as Media Mix Modeling (MMM), predictive lifetime value (pLTV), data-driven attribution, and recommendation systems.
  • Work with third-party data sources and in-house AI-powered prediction engines to enhance marketing efforts and optimize user acquisition strategies.
  • Measure and analyze the impact of integrated brand campaigns and ensure alignment with Uniswap’s long-term goals.

What We’re Looking For:

  • 5+ years of experience in data science or advanced analytics, with a focus on B2C industries, preferably in tech, blockchain, or fintech environments.
  • Proven expertise in segmentation, predictive modeling, and retention strategies, especially within digital marketing channels in the context of DeFi and blockchain.
  • In-depth experience with Media Mix Modeling (MMM), data-driven attribution, customer lifetime value (LTV) prediction, and recommendation systems.
  • Proficiency in using statistical modeling tools and languages like Python, R, SQL, and data visualization platforms such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Experience in building and maintaining reporting systems that communicate the performance of marketing channels, including paid and social.
  • Familiarity with AI-powered tools and integrating these capabilities into marketing strategies.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to distill complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.
  • A passion for blockchain technology, DeFi, and the broader vision of decentralized finance.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing our data analytics infrastructure to support our data-driven decision-making processes. This role requires deep technical expertise, a passion for working with data, and strong analytical skills.

Key Responsibilities

Data Infrastructure Development:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
  • Implement data integration solutions to consolidate data from various sources, ensuring data quality and integrity.
  • Optimize data storage and retrieval processes for performance and scalability.

Analytics and Reporting:

  • Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business analytics and decision-making.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide robust solutions.
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategy.

Data Quality and Governance:

  • Implement data validation and monitoring processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
  • Establish and enforce data governance policies and best practices.
  • Conduct regular audits and data quality assessments to identify and resolve data issues.

Collaboration and Communication:

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and business teams, to understand data requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
  • Communicate complex data insights and technical details to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior data engineers and analysts.

Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay current with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and analytics.
  • Continuously evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to improve data processing, analysis, and visualization capabilities.
  • Drive the adoption of best practices in data engineering and analytics across the organization.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data engineering, data analytics, or a related field.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
  • Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake).
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Scala.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes, data modeling, and data warehousing concepts.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Knowledge of machine learning and data science techniques.
  • Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies (e.g., Kafka, Flink).
  • Relevant certifications in data engineering or analytics.

Uniswap Labs is seeking a Technical Partner Success Manager to support the growing ecosystem of businesses and developers integrating with UniswapX and our Trading APIs. This role sits at the intersection of B2B customer success, technical support, integrations engineering, and strategic partner management, developing innovative systems that ensure seamless integrations for some of the largest partners in our industry.

As we continue to grow our products, we need a proactive and technically adept individual to be the face of Uniswap Labs for our most important partners. You will act as a trusted advisor and primary point of contact, ensuring our partners have a smooth integration experience while advocating for their needs internally.

  • Update and maintain developer documentation to enhance self-serve integration capabilities.

  • Customer-focused and relationship-driven, comfortable engaging with executives, business partners, and developers to ensure a high-quality experience.

You’ll also mentor a powerhouse team renowned for punching above its weight, while managing top-tier collaborations with external partners. Event Strategy -

Uniswap Labs is seeking a Research Data Scientist, who will work in a highly collaborative and cross-functionally team setting to further our understanding of the protocol and product usage, and to contribute toward future product innovations through research. Active areas of study include deepening understanding of liquidity demand and provision in decentralized exchanges, quantifying and predicting behaviors of different market participant, design mechanisms to prevent and deter market manipulation and reduce systemic risk. Candidates must have strong curiosity to drive understanding in DeFi, interest in applying research to application, and desire to share knowledge broadly.

Candidates should have familiarity the Uniswap Protocol, and its surrounding ecosystem of products, and DeFi/web3. Additionally, candidates should have strong communication skills and be capable of sharing their work with members across the team. 


What You Will Do:

  • Systematically test and expand hypotheses to shape protocol and product improvements
  • Develop statistical and machine learning models to understand and predict market participant behaviors and interaction with other protocols in DeFi
  • Source data and implementing metrics that further understanding of products across the Uniswap ecosystem
  • Work on self-directed and collaborative research projects that contribute to future product innovations
  • Collaborate with internal and external researchers to study and elucidate protocol usage and associated market dynamics



Requirements:

  • Bachelors/Masters/Ph.D. in quantitative fields (CS, Stats, economics, etc) with 2+ years work experience
  • Experience in processing, analyzing, and reporting on financial or consumer product data
  • Experience with SQL and Python/C++
  • An inquisitive mindset and ability to tackle challenges with limited guidance
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to team members across other domains
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a deeply collaborative work environment
  • Experience in financial services/startups/tech



Nice to Have:

  • Experience within DeFi/web3
  • Experience in a research role that applies scientific rigor to solve complex problems in an area of domain expertise
  • Experience with blockchain data and analytics tools
  • Fondness for the color pink

About: 

We’re looking for a strategic and creative Senior Events Associate to join the marketing team and lead the execution of key Uniswap events across global markets. This is suitable for someone with demonstrated ownership of regional strategies, budget autonomy, and cross-functional leadership. You’ll drive experiential strategy and production across diverse formats — from immersive house activations to co-branded partner events, community dinners, and high-profile conference experiences.

This role works closely with our Events Lead and collaborates cross-functionally with teams like international growth, product, comms, design, and partnerships. You’ll also be the on-the-ground lead for IRL activations, overseeing logistics, partner relations, budget management, and execution in global cities. This is a hands-on role ideal for a highly autonomous executor with a sharp eye for community culture and a deep pulse on crypto trends.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Ownership & Planning

  • Lead end-to-end execution of select events in the US and abroad in alignment with team priorities.
  • Own the full life cycle of assigned events — from goals and ideation to post-event reporting.
  • Propose new event formats and activation concepts that drive community engagement.
  • Provide input on event strategy  and collaborate with stakeholders to align on goals & KPIs.

Budget & Vendor Management

  • Independently manage multi-tiered event budgets ranging from $10K–$200K.
  • Lead vendor sourcing, negotiation, and contracting; identify cost efficiencies while upholding brand standards.
  • Ensure compliance with local regulations and coordinate with legal for contracting, permits, and risk mitigation.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Be the connective tissue across marketing, product, growth, internationalization, and BD to ensure cohesive event narratives.
  • Lead kickoff syncs, project manage dependencies, and run post-mortems to continuously refine processes.
  • Collaborate with Comms, Social, and Design teams to develop compelling event collateral and social strategies.

Execution & Leadership

  • Oversee end-to-end logistics and vendor management on-site across various time zones.
  • Lead freelance teams, agencies, and internal staff on-site.

Reporting & Impact Measurement

  • Develop post-event reports with attendee insights, engagement data, and impact metrics.
  • Use feedback to inform future event improvements and campaign integration.

Required Experience

  • 5+ years in experiential marketing, event strategy, or community experience roles, preferably in tech or crypto.
  • Demonstrated ownership of regional or product-led event strategy.
  • Strong cross-functional leadership experience, particularly with product, partnerships, and international teams.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity with high autonomy and clear communication.
  • Proficiency in on-the-ground execution with attention to guest experience and brand integrity.
  • NYC-based or willing to travel up to 20% of the time.

Nice to Haves

  • Deep understanding of DeFi and the Ethereum ecosystem.
  • Experience in grassroots community engagement and international market entry.
  • Comfort with Discord, Telegram, and other community channels.
  • Creative production or design background.
  • Existing relationships with key builders and Web3 communities.

  • Ecosystem Partner Activation

    Independently build and manage Unichain’s core partner stack—wallets, RPCs, bridges, indexers, and dev tools. Develop partnership tracks tailored to specific use cases (ie. token issuance, LP onboarding, cross-chain swaps) to reduce friction and enable composability across key DeFi primitives. Support UVN’s launch.

    Impact: unlocks access, usability, and product readiness for core DeFi flows

  • Liquidity Migration & Onramping

    Own and execute Labs' liquidity-focused adoption push—starting with Q2 LP onboarding and activation. Design and manage liquidity migration strategies (e.g., LP tooling, partner zaps, migration funnels) and lead coordination with key market makers. Develop strategies for driving inflows from key ecosystems (ie. Base, Arbitrum, eth mainnet).

    Impact: Increases TVL, swap volume, and LP activity on Unichain

  • Token Issuance & Asset Growth (V4)

    Build and scale onboarding motion for token factories, TGEs, and pre-launch partners. Help projects launch natively on Unichain by coordinating liquidity seeding, partner listings (wallets, FOR), and ongoing support for hook-driven token models.

    Impact: drive net new liquidity

  • Builder Recruitment & App Activation

    Lead targeted outreach and support for early-stage native protocol teams and mature cross-chain apps. Prioritize verticals that align with sequencer fee generation and volume growth (ie. swaps, stablecoins, cross-chain messaging).

    Impact: grows transaction activity and sequencer revenue via increased app footprint

  • Cross-Ecosystem Liquidity & Interop

    Design systems and partnerships, in conjunction with BD & research, that improve liquidity routing and interoperability (ie. Superchain routing, filler alignment, stablecoin pools). Push Unichain toward becoming the liquidity backbone for trading across chains.

    Impact: position Unichain as the most effective DeFi execution layer in the Superchain ecosystem

  • Partner Alignment

    Strategize how Uniswap Labs products can act as force multiplier for ecosystem building efforts from Uniswap Foundation, Optimism Foundation, Flashbots and other key foundation partners on all Unichain adoption programs. Drive shared meetings, sync on ecosystem activation, and ensure partners are effectively executing on necessary commitments.

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years years of professional experience, including:
    • 3-6 years of ecosystem growth, business development or venture investing experience.
    • 1-3 years in crypto-native roles with demonstrated knowledge of the industry.
  • Strong understanding of the Ethereum layer 2 landscape and how to build a successful DeFi ecosystem.
  • Expertise in Uniswap protocols, product suite, and the broader crypto landscape.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to diverse audiences.
  • Proven ability to influence and persuade external stakeholders effectively.
  • Willingness to travel up to 3-4 weeks annually to support global ecosystem growth initiatives

As Engineering Manager for the Protocols team, you’ll guide the engineers who design, build, and harden the smart-contract systems that power Uniswap V4, UniswapX and beyond.

Key Responsibilities

  • People Leadership: Hire, coach, and grow a diverse team of world-class smart-contract engineers while fostering a security-first, inclusive, high-performance culture. Provide clear growth paths, feedback, and mentorship.
  • Technical Direction: Own the architecture and roadmap for Uniswap’s Solidity-based protocol (hooks, cross-chain deployments, governance upgrades) and champion best practices in gas optimization, modular design, and upgrade-safe patterns.
  • Security & Audits: Drive a rigorous SDLC that includes threat modeling, formal verification, fuzzing, and multiple external audit loops. Coordinate with leading audit firms and run our internal red-team / bug-bounty triage.
  • Project Execution: Translate product and research goals into executable engineering plans, then prioritize and track work to hit aggressive but realistic milestones across multiple chains.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with Product, Legal, Security, Design, and Community teams to ship features that delight users while protecting billions in TVL.

Minimum Requirements

  • 8+ years total software engineering experience, including 3+ years building production EVM smart-contract systems in Solidity (or low-level languages like Huff/Yul) and 2+ years managing engineers.
  • Proven track record shipping contracts that have held significant TVL and zero critical exploits.
  • Deep knowledge of the EVM and DeFi mechanics (AMMs, oracles, bridges).
  • Hands-on experience leading smart contract security efforts including external security audits, formal verification, static analysis etc.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to explain complex protocol trade-offs to both engineers and non-technical stakeholders.
  • B.S./M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent real-world experience.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Contributions to open-source DeFi protocols or Ethereum Improvement Proposals.
  • Familiarity with L2s, cross-chain messaging, account abstraction (ERC-4337), or zero-knowledge proofs.
  • Experience with Foundry, Hardhat, Slither, Echidna, Certora, MythX, or similar tooling.
